subproject.description:
Objectives:
The project has four strategic outputs; to provide the women victims of violence an alternative mechanism where they can obtain gender justice; build the capacity of the Musalihat Anjumans (MAs) to dispense gender-responsive justice; enhance public engagement with, and utilization of the services of the Musalihat Anjuman (MAs) and promote women’s awareness of their legal rights and man’s active participation in ending gender-based violence. 

1. Justice for Women Victims of Gender Violence:
Districts where Insaaf Committees/MAs exist will be mapped in consultations with the Provincial Local Government & Rural Development Departments and pilot district will be selected for the establishment of new MAs. Project Steering Committee meetings will be held for finalizing the work plan for formulation of MAs in all selected Union Councils (UCs) of the pilot districts in accordance with the Local Government Ordinance 2001; followed by visits to these UCs.

2. Capacity Development of MAs:
Rules of Business (RoB) and working Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) will be prepared for the MAs in pilot districts. Training modules for the members of MAs will be developed, related NGOs would be mapped and trainings on various legal issues related to women, will be conducted. Consultations will be held on the provincial and district level for the formation of Musalihat Anjuman Support Services (MASS), comprising of a network of gender/human rights NGOs, lawyers and councillors, for strengthening, sustaining MA activities and building the capacity of MAs. 

3. Awareness Raising on the Use of MAs:
Musalihat Anjuman Justice Advocates (MAJA) networks will be constituted and mobilized at the provincial and pilot district levels and awareness raising campaigns will be launched in all the pilot districts. Information will be disseminated through the MAs as a tool for providing relief to the victims of gender violence. Furthermore, one provincial level and one pilot district level workshop will be held for sharing experiences and issues arising from the functioning of the MAs.

4. Community Advocacy :
Pilot district level workshops of the lady councillors, elected members, judiciary, police and provincial government representatives will be held on women’s legal rights and ending violence, especially in the light of the MA experience. Pamphlets and other resource material will be prepared and distributed from court information centers and schools and colleges for awareness raising on gender violence issues. 

Legal, judicial and police reforms introduced and implementation strategy developed - Alternate Dispute Resolution (CPAP Output: Governance 1.3)
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: PRU-Gender Justice (GJTMA)

subproject.description:
Gen-Prom is an initiative of UNDP (Unite Nations Development Programme) to enhance the skill level of garments and sewing industry workers and promote gender so that this important backbone industry of Pakistan can survive the tough challenges of global competition. On one hand, there is a high level of unemployment in Pakistan and on the other hand, this vital industry is hungry for skilled and efficient work force. 
The labor ratio of textile industry of Pakistan is highly skewed towards males and this is very different from the competing nations of the global textile business. Gen-Prom project aims at building capacity of sewing factories to be able to train work force in an organized manner with state of the art curriculum and trained Master Trainers. The project provides training to unskilled workers in the area of cutting, stitching, finishing, packing, quality assurance, and quality control, as per the needs of companies participating in the project
For this purpose, the project has hired the world renowned consultant for garment manufacturing training; Techno Pak (India) who is providing curriculum and training under the project.


Gender Promotion in the Garment/ Clothing sector through skills development
subproject.gender code: Gender Equality as a principal objective
subproject.title: PRU-GENPROM

subproject.description:
Objective:

The aim of the project is to develop a cadre of trained women livestock extension agents to provide primary animal health and production services at the village level through capacity building interventions leading to enhanced income and generation of employment opportunities for women.

Community Empowerment through Livestock Development & Credit
subproject.gender code: Gender Equality as a principal objective
subproject.title: (PRU)-Women in Livestock

subproject.description: The objective is to create and support mechanism to support and sustainable reduction in Violence Against Women (VAW) in Pakistan. The objective of the project will be realized through targetted interventions for achieving the following outputs: (1) External resource pools responsive to supporting proposals that aim to address VAW; (2) Government and CSOs capacity strengthened to access and effectively utilize funds from resource pools for initiatives to reduce VAW; and (3) Good practices and protection embedded in government policy and processes on VAW.
subproject.gender code: Gender Equality as a principal objective
subproject.title: DGU-Gender Justice & Protect

subproject.title: DGU-Gender Justice & Protect

subproject.description: The project aims to: (1) empower and capacitate current and potential duty bearers particularly women at federal, provincial and district levels to own and promote devolved gender based goverannce; (2) strengthen civil service training institutions contributing to civil service reforms and gender based governance; and (3) put in place credible sustainable monitoring systems for gender based governance.
subproject.gender code: Gender Equality as a principal objective
subproject.title: DGU-Gender Based Govt System
